name: 7.6 "Norm, Is That You?" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 7 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did the man think about Rebecca?
questions.explanation:
that she was pregnant.

	Rebecca was very angry when the man accused her of being pregnant. She also then realized that she needed to lose some weight.

Butthead.

	Woody told him that "it only looked that way from the back". Sam of course had to get a mirror and check it out himself.

questions.text: Who did Lilith and Frasier fire?
questions.explanation:
Ivan.

	Frasier told Ivan, "You're too good for us." Ivan was played by B.J. Turner.

questions.text: Why was Norm at the Cranes' house?
questions.explanation:
He was painting.

	Norm agreed to paint their living room for them. He actually was a very good painter.

questions.correct: the ability to do interior design work
options: the ability to climb a mountain
the ability to make great small talk with strangers
the ability to play the piano
questions.explanation:
the ability to do interior design work.

	Norm moved a few things around Frasier and Lilith's apartment and they loved it. They ended up using Norm to do interior decorating along with painting.

questions.text: What did Sam say after he offered Rebecca a brownie?
questions.correct: "A moment on the lips, a lifetime on the hips."
options: "A moment on the lips, a lifetime on the hips."
"A skinny chick now, a fat one later."
"I'd give you one, but you're too fat."
questions.explanation:
"A moment on the lips, a lifetime on the hips."

	Sam enjoyed teasing Rebecca whenever he could. It was a good thing they were such good friends.

questions.text: Did Norm want people to know about his talent?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Norm said he spent most of his life hiding this interior decorating gift he had. Frasier and Lilith thought he shouldn't be ashamed of it.

questions.text: What car did the Cranes' friends' friends drive to the Cranes' house?
questions.explanation:
BMW.

	They told them that they couldn't decide between the BMW or the Range Rover so Frasier said, "Well don't keep us in suspense." The man replied "The Beamer of course."

questions.text: What did the Coopermans think about Norm?
options: That he was a bad designer
questions.explanation:
That he was gay.

	The Coopermans put labels on everyone based on what they could do. Norm wanted the job badly enough that he let them think he was gay.

questions.text: Who did Norm pretend to be dating?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam quickly made it very clear that he liked "babes" as he put it. Norm said that "babes" was Sam's pet name for linebackers.
